description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission ref: 201492FUL dated 25/11/2020 for: Construction of part single storey, part three storey, building to include 8 self-contained residential units, associated landscaping works and provision of refuse space, car parking and cycle parking (following demolition of existing building. Amendment seeks consent for the revised front boundary wall treatment including removal of vehicle parking space, and a crossover and use of on-street parking space instead
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): 3192-CB-A-DR-0001 Rev A Existing Site Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-0002 Rev A Site Location Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-0010 Rev A Existing Ground Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1003 Rev C Existing As Approved Ground Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-0011 Rev A Existing First Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-0050 Rev A Existing South Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-0051 Rev A Existing East Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-0052 Rev A Existing North Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-0053 Rev A Existing West Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-1001 Proposed Site Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1010 Rev C Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1011 Rev B Proposed First Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1012 Rev B Proposed Second Floor Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1013 Rev B Proposed Roof Plan, 3192-CB-A-DR-1051 Rev C Proposed South Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-1052 Rev B Proposed North Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-1053 Rev B Proposed West Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-1054 Rev B Proposed East Elevation, 3192-CB-A-DR-1071 Rev B Proposed Section, 3192-CB-A-DR-1072 Rev B Proposed Section B, DWG001 Illustrative Landscape Masterplan, Daylight & Sunlight Study dated 21 May 2020, Design & Access Statement, Planning Statement.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be in accordance with 204484CND dated 27.01.2021

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front gardens of the properties, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and D8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The window/s inserted in the side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD.

| Cycle storage for fourteen (14) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 and T3 of the London Plan (2021).
| Details of an enhanced sound insulation shall be in accordance with 205044CND dated 30.03.2021.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Details of demolition method statement and a construction management plan shall be in accordance with 205045CND dated 27.07.2021

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies T4, T6, SI1 and D14 of the London Plan 2021, the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
| Details of hard and soft landscaping shall be in accordance with 211292CND dated 01.04.2021

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, and in accordance with policies 7.4, 7A, 7B and 7D of Ealing Council's Adopted Development Management DPD.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.
Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building.
| Prior to the occupation of the site, the existing southernmost crossover shall be removed and the kerb is to be reinstated. This is to be done at the applicants expense.
Reason: To enhance the street scene and remove conflicting modes of transport, in according with policies D3 and T3 of the London Plan (2021).
